title: Tom Brady ‘was supposed’ to play for Raiders upon leaving Patriots, Las Vegas owner Mark Davis said
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady nearly joined the Las Vegas Raiders in 2020, but team leadership chose a different direction, according to owner Mark Davis.
Brady, now a minority owner of the Raiders, acquired a 10% stake in May 2023 after retiring from the NFL.
The NFL has lifted some restrictions on Brady's broadcasting role with FOX, now allowing him attendance in production meetings.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Friendship' starring Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd is available on HBO Max, exploring suburban humor.
'Highest 2 Lowest,' a Spike Lee film with Denzel Washington, is streaming on Apple TV+.
'The Great British Baking Show' Season 16 is now streaming on Netflix, showcasing amateur baker competitions.

title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers returns to Foxborough as a Raider for the first time since leaving the Patriots.
New Raiders head coach Pete Carroll praised the Patriots' running game and front seven's physicality.
Patriots start the Mike Vrabel era against the Raiders, with changes in coaching and player positions.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown joined YouTube streamer IShowSpeed for a live stream tour of Boston, including a Boston Tea Party reenactment.
Brown jokingly criticized taxes while tossing buckets of tea like basketballs into the water on a Boston Tea Party Ship.
During the tour, Brown raced IShowSpeed in Downtown Crossing, with the streamer claiming victory after allegedly pulling a hamstring.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell is set to debut as the Patriots' starting left tackle against the Raiders despite an ankle injury.
Dante Scarnecchia praised Campbell's run-blocking and competitiveness, downplaying concerns over his arm length.
Campbell received high grades in preseason for pass and run blocking, expecting challenges against NFL defenders.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: UNC coach Bill Belichick bans Patriots scouts from attending practices and games, citing past tensions with the team.
Mike Vrabel says Patriots will find alternative ways to scout UNC players despite the ban.
Belichick's college coaching debut with UNC resulted in a 48-14 loss against TCU.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A University of Rhode Island student is suing after allegedly being filmed in a unisex dorm shower.
The lawsuit claims URI's lax security placed the student in a vulnerable position, leading to defamation and emotional distress.
James Paquette, identified as filming the incident, faces a state-level charge of video voyeurism.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez will miss the Patriots' season opener against the Raiders due to a hamstring injury.
Rookie left tackle Will Campbell is questionable for the game with an ankle injury after limited practice participation.
Quarterback Geno Smith and head coach Pete Carroll lead the Raiders against a revamped Patriots secondary Sunday.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Celtics' Jordan Walsh reports Jayson Tatum is progressing well in recovery from Achilles tear.
No timeline set for Tatum's return, but he has been active in the Celtics practice facility.
Team president Rich Gotham says Tatum's return timing depends on ongoing rehabilitation progress.

title: 5 things to know about the Raiders ahead of Sunday’s matchup against the Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Raiders have a new coach-QB duo with Pete Carroll and Geno Smith, who were successful together at the Seahawks.
Tom Brady, a minority owner of the Raiders, will not attend Sunday's game due to his Fox Sports obligations.
Las Vegas's Brock Bowers is projected as a top NFL tight end, with notable past rookie records in receptions and yards.
